result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: count two and any other time being served.  Huber release for medical care/treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Fine of $300.00.
AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO:  all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees and assessments.
AS TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS ORDERED ON THIS CASE:  to be paid by end of supervision period or any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment. Bail to apply. 
*** Balance of bail if any, to be held until issue of restitution resolved.

If deemed necessary/appropriate by agent defendant to obtain mental assessment and if necessary, successfully complete follow up treatment.
Take all presription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No violent contact with victim Jeff M. or Betty A.

Coperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in anger management program.
Pay all supervision fees.

Hearing on October 2, 2014.
**10/2/2014 Set at zero.

Defendant Michael D Stone in court with attorney Manuel R. Galang.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs Court they have complied with victim notification and have been unable to contact the victim.  Victim did not appear in court on today's date.
On motion of the State, Court orders Restitution set at $ 0 (zero)

No further action by the Court on this date.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Michael D Stone in court with attorney Manuel R. Galang.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
 
Amend Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Charges amended to:

COUNT 1: DUTY UPON STRIKING OCCUPIED OR ATTENDED VEHICLE(PROPERTY DAMAGE ONLY) , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.67(1), 346.74(5)(a), a Misdemeanor

COUNT 2:  DISORDERLY CONDUCT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b) , a Class B Misdemeanor

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to both Counts:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Jury Trial set for 8-04-14 removed from the calendar at this time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Manuel R Galang in court, defendant Michael D Stone not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Final pretrial held between counsel.  Parties re-engaged in settlement negotiations.  Joint request for additional final pretrial/guilty plea date prior to jury trial date granted.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael D Stone in court with Attorney Manuel R Galang.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the court for Scheduling conference.  Defense in a contest posture.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael D Stone in court with attorney Manuel R. Galang.  Benjamin Lindsay for Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-10-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Betty A. or Jeff M. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant Michael D Stone in court with attorney Manuel R. Galang.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/2/14 @ 1:30pm
